text: Krueger's Cream Ale and Krueger's Finest Beer went on sale in Richmond, Virginia in cans, developed by the American Can Company. Cans protected beer better than translucent bottles.

Percy LeBaron Spencer received a patent for a "Method of Treating Foodstuffs" which we would recognize as the microwave oven. Spencer was working on an active radar set and accidentally melted a candy bar in his pocket.
The original Macintosh was introduced becoming the first commercially successful personal computer to feature a mouse and a graphical user interface rather than a command line interface.
